    All Classes and Interfaces

    Class
    Description
    Computer
    Represents a Computer device in the network.
    Device
    Abstract class representing a generic network device.
    DeviceCreationMenu
    The DeviceCreationMenu class provides a user interface through the console for creating various types of network devices (Router, Switch, Server, etc.) and adding them to the network topology.
    DeviceWithCLI
    An interface representing a device that has a Command Line Interface (CLI).
    DHCPServer
    Represents a DHCP server in the network simulation Responsible for configuring IP pools, assigning IP addresses to devices, and managing the availability of IP addresses within defined pools.
    DHCPServerMenu
    The DHCPServerMenu class provides a console-based interface for managing DHCP server devices within a network simulation.
    DNSServer
    Represents a DNS server in the network simulation.
    DNSServerMenu
    The DNSServerMenu class provides a text-based menu system for managing DNS servers in a simulated network environment.
    ErrorMessages
    An enumeration of error messages used in network configurations.
    FreeModeMenu
    The FreeModeMenu class provides a user interface for managing and configuring a network in Free Mode.
    GuidedModeMenu
    The GuidedModeMenu class provides a user interface to guide the user through the process of setting up a VLAN network for an office building in Guided Mode.
    GuidedModeUtils
    Utility class for displaying formatted text boxes in the console.
    IPPool
    Represents a pool of IP addresses that can be assigned to devices.
    Layer2Switch
    Represents a Layer 2 Switch in the network.
    Layer3Switch
    Represents a Layer 3 Switch capable of both switching and basic routing.
    MainMenu
    Utility class to display the main menu and progress bar in a console-based application.
    NetworkManager
    NetworkManager is responsible for managing network-related tasks, including static IP allocation, finding Layer 3 devices, and finding DHCP servers.
    NetworkSimulationRunner
    The NetworkSimulationRunner class serves as the entry point for simulating a network environment.
    PCMenu
    A menu class for managing PCs in the network simulation.
    Router
    Represents a Router capable of static IP allocation, port IP assignments, and VLAN interface configuration.
    RouterMenu
    A menu class for managing routers in the network simulation.
    Switch
    Abstract base class representing a switch with VLAN support Provides VLAN configuration and port assignment tracking
    SwitchMenu
    A menu class for managing switches in the network simulation.
    Topology
    The Topology class manages the network topology, registering devices, connecting and disconnecting devices, and maintaining the adjacency list to represent the device network structure.
    TopologyMenu
    A menu class that allows the user to manage the network topology, including adding and removing connections between devices within the network.
    TopologyVisualiser
    The TopologyVisualiser class provides a GUI window that visually represents the network topology.
    VLANInterface
    Represents a VLAN interface on a network device.
    WebServer
    Represents a basic Web Server device that can serve content to users
    WebServerMenu
    A menu class that allows the user to manage web servers in the network.
